alert.note: Alert for Clay; Wichita (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jefferson, southern Stephens, southeastern Cotton, Carter, southwestern Murray, northern Clay and southeastern Wichita Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 830 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Turner Falls to 9 miles southwest of Loco to 5 miles east of Randlett. Movement was south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Wichita Falls, Ardmore, Davis, Waurika, Lone Grove, Healdton, Wilson, Comanche, Ringling, Temple, Ryan, Springer, Petrolia, Byers, Dean, Randlett, Dougherty, Jolly, Gene Autry and Tatums. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 35 and 55. Interstate 44 between mile markers 10 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
